resources.string: Set the app theme: Light or dark.
Keep and append original name, for example, from DSC_09.JPG the new name will be %s_DSC_09.JPG
Restart the app to apply the selected language.
This option allow you to choose above delay units between seconds and minutes.
Show or not the confirmation dialog when the DSC rename service is launched from shortcut.
Do you want to start manually the rename service?
If selected file(s) are not in a selected folder, they can not be renamed to comply with Android security restrictions.\nDo you want to start manually renaming them?
Create a DSC file renaming shortcut on your home screen, to start renaming files manually.
Unable to create DSC file renaming shortcut, please try to manually remove the created shortcut.
Extensions for file renaming candidates to search for: (\"DSC_*.JPG\" or \"MOV_*.MP4\"), e.g. %s \nWildcards \"*\" and \"?\" can be used too.
If you appreciate this application, you can donate to show your support with DSC Auto Rename PRO!\nPressing \"Yes\" will take you to the Google Play Store.\nThank you for using this app!
Please make a donation if you appreciate this app.
Files are automatically renamed after conditions to do so are met.

Because of security constraints on Android KitKat, if you are running that, this app will not be able to rename files on external SD cards.\nSee the link http://goo.gl/kJeED3 for a possible fix.\nThis app can only rename files from internal memory, so your camera app must be set to only save files there.
Please enable \"Rename one folder\" option and select which folder should be scanned for pictures and clips to be renamed, using \"List of scanned folders.\".
Lets you restrict file renaming to selected folders, as opposed to normally scanning all files on device.
Enable this feature and chose folders where your camera app saves files.

Are you sure you want to scan for files from selected folders? This option is necessary if you disabled the MediaScanner. If you enable this option the app will recursively scan all the selected folders above!
Only select this if your have turned off the MediaScanner service on your device. The file renaming will also scan for media files in the selected folders above.
Scan for files recursively on selected folders
The file %s can not be renamed.
A file can not be read or written to
Do you want to export app settings?
Export settings to a local folder.
Unable to export settings to a local folder.\nError: %s
The file extension will be kept.

Old file name example:
	 %1$s
Renamed file name example:
	 %2$s
At least one filename pattern should be left unchecked.
Do you want to remove the selected filename pattern?
Select at least one filename pattern to delete.
The original pattern is too generic, causing files to be renamed over and over again. Try to define a more restrictive pattern using \"?"\ and other used characters.
The original and rename pattern are matching!
Renamed filename pattern cannot be empty.
Original filename pattern already exists, change the text to get a new one.
The original pattern matches a rename pattern defined earlier!
The rename pattern matches an original pattern defined earlier!
This suffix is used when more than one file has same name, like in \"burst"\ cases. By default the counter has 5 digits.\nExample:\n%s
Do you want to reset the renamed files counter?
Touch to reset the number of renamed files.
At least one folder should be left unchecked.
Do you want to remove the selected folders?

Your system revoked permissions for the folder below:

%s

Check where this folder was defined and try to select it again.

You may ignore this message, but the app will not work properly till it has gained access to the folder above.

Your system revoked permissions for the folders below:

%s

Check where these folders were defined and try to select them again.

You may ignore this message, but the app will not work properly till it has gained access to the folders above.
Your Android version does not have support for choosing folders (ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT_TREE).\nDo you want to use the internal folder picker to select a folder? It can not rename and move files.
Select at least one folder to delete.
Do you want to import app settings? Existing settings will be overwritten, the app will restart after the import finishes.
Import settings from a local folder, existing settings will be overwritten.
Import settings from a local folder, existing settings will be overwritten. Not all paths will be imported, you should manually check paths to gain access from Android OS.
Unable to import settings from file.\nError: %s
Use the MediaScanner service to scan renamed files, use this with caution, normally it should not be selected! Use it force updating of the MTP cache, unfortunately it does not always work!
No files were renamed. Please verify:\n-Find out where the camera files are saved, and make sure they are selected,;\n-and that the defined filename patterns are correct.
The app was not able to rename one file due to missing folder access rights, please select the folder the stored file is in again.
The app was not able to rename %d files, please select the folders the are stored files are in again.
The manual renaming service is running.
Touch to start manually renaming files
Move the renamed file to the selected folder below.
No folder selected, touch this text to select a folder.
View the terms of the privacy policy
Remove the DSC file renaming shortcut from your home screen
Remove the DSC file renaming shortcut on your home screen. If you want to enable it again, manually remove the existing icon from you home screen.
date and time the file was last modified.

string-array.name: rename_file_using_labels
string-array.item: date and time the file was added to media provider;
date and time the file was last modified;

resources.string: By checking this option, videos are automatically renamed too, by default only pictures are renamed.
Do you want to request the required app permissions?
Touch this to ask the system for the priviliges the app needs to function: Camera (used to receive the time the image was shot), Storage (used to rename and move files).
All required permissions have been granted.
Broadcast message of renamed files, using this option other apps could pick up the renamed file, or the event of doing so.
Do you want to send a debugging report?\nYour default e-mail app will send an e-mail with two files attached, please fill out a short description of your issues, if necessary.\nThank you.
Send an e-mail with debugging files
Debugging logs for DSC Auto Rename
The auto rename service is disabled. No files will be renamed.
The auto rename service is triggered by notifications of camera events, if any.
The auto rename service is triggered by notifications of media content events, if any.
The auto rename service is triggered when a file is added for selected folders. You must check \"Rename one folder\" and have a least one folder under watch with \"Select a folder\".
The auto rename service is always running in the background, but the files are renamed only when the camera app sends out events notifications.

string-array.name: service_type_labels
string-array.item: Camera events: Pictures or videos taken.
Media content observer: Pictures or videos saved.
File observer: Watch selected folders for added files. You must check \"Rename one folder\" and have a least one folder under watch with \"Select a folder\".
A permanently running service, used to catch notification events from the camera app.

string-array.name: service_type_labels_v21
string-array.item: Media content observer: Pictures or videos saved.
File observer: Watch selected folders for added files. You must check \"Rename one folder\" and have a least one folder under watch with \"Select a folder\".

resources.string: Thank you for the appreciation of my work, in buying the \"PRO"\ version.
Please read the Help section below!

This plugin doesn\'t offer any configuration. Please use the main App \"DSC Auto Rename\" to configure settings.\n\nInvoking this plugin will have the same effect as starting the renaming process with the widget.
